citeinfo.title: ISLSCP II AVHRR Albedo and BRDF, 1995

descript.abstract: This Albedo and BRDF (Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function) data set contains three files containing BRDF parameters, white- sky albedo and black-sky albedo at solar noon for three bands ((350-680nm, 680-3000nm, and 350-30000nm)derived from AVHRR (Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer). These data are available at spatial resolutions of quarter, half, and one degree. Black-sky albedo (direct beam contribution) and white-sky (Completely diffuse contribution) can be linearly combined as a function of the fraction of diffuse skylight (itself a function of optical depth) to provide an actual or instantaneous albedo at local solar noon.

VEGETATION COVER|MODIS (MODERATE-RESOLUTION IMAGING SPECTRORADIOMETER)|TERRA (MORNING EQUATORIAL CROSSING TIME SATELLITE)
CANOPY CHARACTERISTICS|AVHRR (ADVANCED VERY HIGH RESOLUTION RADIOMETER)|NOAA-14 (NATIONAL OCEANIC & ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION-14)
ALBEDO|AVHRR (ADVANCED VERY HIGH RESOLUTION RADIOMETER)|NOAA-14 (NATIONAL OCEANIC & ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION-14)

Landis (eds.). ISLSCP Initiative II Collection. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov/] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. doi:10.3334/ORNLDAAC/928
